title: Authors and Citation
text: First Last. Maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Name Y (2025). MRcare: Causal Analysis Randomized Estimators (CARE). R package version 1.1, https://chongwulab.github.io/MRcare, https://github.com/ChongWuLab/MRcare.
code: @Manual{,   title = {MRcare: Causal Analysis with Randomized Estimators (CARE)},   author = {Your Name},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 1.1, https://chongwulab.github.io/MRcare},   url = {https://github.com/ChongWuLab/MRcare}, }

title: Causal Analysis with Randomized Estimators (CARE)
text: Mendelian Randomization (MR) powerful approach estimating causal effects modifiable exposures health outcomes using genetic variants instrumental variables. MRcare implements Causal Analysis Randomized Estimators (CARE) method, addresses three major challenges MR studies: Horizontal pleiotropy: genetic variants affect outcome pathways exposure Winner’s curse bias: Inflation effect sizes data used instrument selection effect estimation Measurement error bias: Errors estimated genetic associations exposure Unlike traditional MR methods, CARE delivers reliable causal inference even biases present, providing accurate estimates improved statistical power. Additionally, MRcare implements Rerandomized Inverse Variance Weighted estimator (RIVW), systematically corrects winner’s curse, leading unbiased association effect estimates selected genetic variants valid instrumental variable assumptions.

title: Causal Analysis with Randomized Estimators (CARE)
text: can install released version MRcare CRAN : install development version GitHub:
code: install.packages("MRcare")  # Coming soon # install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("yourgithub/MRcare")

title: Causal Analysis with Randomized Estimators (CARE)
text: using MRcare analysis, need configure package required resources: one-time configuration : - Check PLINK 1.9 installation (downloading needed) - Download reference panels linkage disequilibrium (LD) calculations - Save configuration future sessions default, European ancestry (EUR) data 1000 Genomes Project used. can specify different ancestry: already PLINK 1.9 reference panels installed:
code: library(MRcare) configure_mrcare() configure_mrcare(ancestry = "AFR")  # African ancestry configure_mrcare(   plink_path = "/path/to/plink",   ref_panel_path = "/path/to/reference/panel" )

title: Causal Analysis with Randomized Estimators (CARE)
text: MRcare requires preprocessed GWAS summary statistics exposure outcome: preprocessing function standardizes column names, performs quality control, prepares data MR analysis: - Detects standardizes column names common GWAS formats - Removes variants missing values - Filters strand-ambiguous SNPs avoid alignment issues - Applies minor allele frequency (MAF) filtering - Removes duplicated SNPs
code: # Preprocess exposure GWAS data exposure_processed <- preprocess_gwas_data(   gwas_data = "raw_exposure_gwas.txt",    output_file = "processed_exposure.txt",   data_type = "exposure",   Ninput = 10000  # Optional: specify sample size if not in the data )  # Preprocess outcome GWAS data outcome_processed <- preprocess_gwas_data(   gwas_data = "raw_outcome_gwas.txt",    output_file = "processed_outcome.txt",   data_type = "outcome" )

title: Causal Analysis with Randomized Estimators (CARE)
text: main function mr_care() performs Mendelian randomization analysis using CARE method:
code: # Basic usage with default parameters results <- mr_care(   exposure_data = "processed_exposure.txt",   outcome_data = "processed_outcome.txt" )  # Advanced usage with custom parameters results <- mr_care(   exposure_data = "processed_exposure.txt",   outcome_data = "processed_outcome.txt",   bias_correction = "rerand",  # Correction for winner's curse   algorithm = "CD",            # Coordinate descent algorithm   p_threshold = 5e-5,          # Significance threshold for selecting IVs   nrep = 5000,                 # Number of bootstrap repetitions   clump_r2 = 0.001,            # LD clumping r² threshold   clump_kb = 10000             # LD clumping window size in kb )

title: Causal Analysis with Randomized Estimators (CARE)
text: recommend using default settings unless strong reason modify parameters:

title: Causal Analysis with Randomized Estimators (CARE)
text: mr_care() function returns comprehensive results object causal effect estimates:
code: # Display a summary of the results print(results)  # Access specific result components results$BIC       # Results from BIC-selected model (recommended) results$RIVW      # Results from RIVW estimator results$metadata  # Analysis metadata

title: Causal Analysis with Randomized Estimators (CARE)
text: BIC RIVW methods, following statistics provided: estimate: estimated causal effect efron_se: Standard error (Efron’s bootstrap BIC) efron_p: P-value causal effect ci_lower/ci_upper: Confidence interval bounds (via summary function) valid_count: Number valid instruments identified (BIC) nIV: Number instruments used (RIVW)

title: Causal Analysis with Randomized Estimators (CARE)
text: summary function provides clear overview : - Analysis parameters metadata - Instrument strength (F-statistic) - Valid invalid instrument counts - Causal effect estimates confidence intervals BIC method recommended provides robust causal inference accounting horizontal pleiotropy, winner’s curse, measurement error simultaneously.

title: Causal Analysis with Randomized Estimators (CARE)
text: MRcare provides intuitive visualization functions:
code: # Forest plot of BIC and RIVW estimates plot_care(results)  # Scatter plot of exposure vs outcome effects plot_scatter(results, highlight_invalid = TRUE)  # Funnel plot to assess potential pleiotropy plot_funnel(results)  # Combined visualization (all three plots) plot_combined(results)

title: Causal Analysis with Randomized Estimators (CARE)
text: plotting function accepts parameters customization:
code: # Customize forest plot for odds ratios plot_care(   results,   exponentiate = TRUE,    # For odds ratios   ci_level = 0.95,        # Confidence level   xlab = "Odds ratio",    # X-axis label   title = "Causal effect of exposure on outcome" )  # Customize scatter plot plot_scatter(   results,   highlight_invalid = TRUE,  # Highlight invalid instruments   xlab = "Effect on exposure",   ylab = "Effect on outcome",   title = "MR Scatter Plot" )

title: Causal Analysis with Randomized Estimators (CARE)
text: CARE addresses horizontal pleiotropy ℓ₀-constrained optimization framework identifies accounts invalid instruments. employs Coordinate Descent algorithm efficiently identify valid instruments. CARE addresses winner’s curse bias re-randomization approaches accounting measurement error exposure effect estimates invalid instrumental varaibels. method employs bootstrap aggregation (bagging) non-parametric delta method reduce screening variability valid statistical inference.

title: Causal Analysis with Randomized Estimators (CARE)
text: Robust widespread pleiotropy: CARE require balanced pleiotropy assumptions Corrects winner’s curse bias: Enables use liberal p-value thresholds IV selection Accounts measurement error: Reduces bias causal effect estimates Provides valid statistical inference: Maintains validity even IV screening imperfect Computationally efficient: Core algorithms implemented C++ performance

title: Causal Analysis with Randomized Estimators (CARE)
text: detailed information CARE method, please refer :
code: @article{xie2023winners,   title={Winner's Curse Free Robust Mendelian Randomization with Summary Data},   author={Xie, Zhongming and Zhang, Wanheng and Wang, Jingshen and Wu, Chong},   journal={arXiv preprint arXiv:2309.04957},   year={2023} }

title: CARE Bootstrap Analysis — CARE2_boot
text: Performs CARE analysis bootstrapping robust estimation.

title: CARE Bootstrap Analysis — CARE2_boot
code: CARE2_boot(   gamma.exp_sel,   gamma.out_sel,   se.exp_sel,   se.out_sel,   nx,   ny,   nrep = 1000,   algorithm = "Lasso",   random_start = 0,   biascorrect = "no",   etamean = 0.5,   pthr = 5e-05 )

title: CARE Bootstrap Analysis — CARE2_boot
text: gamma.exp_sel Vector genetic associations exposure gamma.out_sel Vector genetic associations outcome se.exp_sel Vector standard errors exposure associations se.out_sel Vector standard errors outcome associations nx Sample size exposure ny Sample size outcome nrep Number bootstrap repetitions algorithm Algorithm use: "Lasso" "CD" (coordinate descent) random_start Number random starting points biascorrect Bias correction method: "", "direct", "rerand", "rerand2", "rerand3" etamean Mean random variable re-randomization pthr P-value threshold selecting significant SNPs

title: CARE Bootstrap Analysis — CARE2_boot
text: list containing CARE analysis results

title: CARE Bootstrap Analysis — CARE2_boot
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ results <- CARE2_boot(beta_exp, beta_out, se_exp, se_out, 10000, 10000) } # }

what: Robust Invalid Variance Weighted Estimator — RIVW
title: Robust Invalid Variance Weighted Estimator — RIVW
text: Performs robust invalid variance weighted estimator Mendelian randomization.

title: Robust Invalid Variance Weighted Estimator — RIVW
code: RIVW(   gamma.exp_sel,   gamma.out_sel,   se.exp_sel,   se.out_sel,   etamean = 0.5,   sel.pthr = 5e-05,   overlap.mat = NULL )

title: Robust Invalid Variance Weighted Estimator — RIVW
text: gamma.exp_sel Vector genetic associations exposure gamma.out_sel Vector genetic associations outcome se.exp_sel Vector standard errors exposure associations se.out_sel Vector standard errors outcome associations etamean Mean random variable re-randomization sel.pthr P-value threshold selecting significant SNPs overlap.mat Overlap matrix correlated samples (NULL independent samples)

title: Robust Invalid Variance Weighted Estimator — RIVW
text: list containing causal estimate, standard error, p-value, number SNPs @export

title: Configure MRcare Environment — configure_mrcare
text: Sets environment MRcare checking installing PLINK, downloading reference panels Hugging Face needed, saving configuration future use. function needs run , configuration used automatically subsequent MRcare analyses.

title: Configure MRcare Environment — configure_mrcare
code: configure_mrcare(   plink_path = NULL,   ref_panel_path = NULL,   cache_dir = NULL,   force_download = FALSE,   ancestry = "EUR",   verbose = TRUE,   test_run = TRUE )

title: Configure MRcare Environment — configure_mrcare
text: plink_path Optional path existing plink 1.9 executable. NULL, attempt find plink download found. ref_panel_path Optional path existing reference panel directory. NULL, download reference panel Hugging Face. cache_dir Directory store downloaded files configuration. NULL, use standard location based operating system. force_download Whether force re-download resources even already exist. Default FALSE. ancestry Ancestry reference panel. Options include "EUR" (European), "AFR" (African), "EAS" (East Asian), "SAS" (South Asian), "AMR" (Admixed American). verbose Whether print detailed progress information. Default TRUE. test_run Whether run test verify configuration. Default TRUE.

title: Configure MRcare Environment — configure_mrcare
text: Invisibly returns list containing configuration parameters

title: Configure MRcare Environment — configure_mrcare
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Default configuration with European ancestry configure_mrcare()  # Using African ancestry reference panel configure_mrcare(ancestry = "AFR")  # Using custom plink and reference panel configure_mrcare(   plink_path = "/path/to/your/plink",   ref_panel_path = "/path/to/your/reference/panel" ) } # }

title: CARE Mendelian Randomization Analysis — mr_care
text: Performs Mendelian randomization analysis using CARE (Causal Analysis Robust plEiotropy) method designed robust horizontal pleiotropy winner's curse.

title: CARE Mendelian Randomization Analysis — mr_care
code: mr_care(   exposure_data,   outcome_data,   clump_r2 = 0.001,   clump_kb = 10000,   p_threshold = 5e-05,   ref_panel = NULL,   bias_correction = c("rerand", "direct", "no"),   algorithm = c("CD", "Lasso"),   nrep = 5000,   random_start = 0,   etamean = 0.5,   temp_dir = NULL,   verbose = TRUE,   plink_path = NULL,   config = TRUE )

title: CARE Mendelian Randomization Analysis — mr_care
text: exposure_data data frame containing exposure GWAS summary statistics, path file containing exposure data outcome_data data frame containing outcome GWAS summary statistics, path file containing outcome data clump_r2 Clumping r-squared threshold. Default 0.001 clump_kb Clumping window size kb. Default 10000 p_threshold P-value threshold selecting significant SNPs. Default 5e-5 ref_panel Path reference panel LD clumping. NULL, use configured reference panel bias_correction Method correcting winner's curse bias: "", "direct", "rerand" (re-randomization). Default "rerand" algorithm Algorithm analysis: "Lasso" "CD" (coordinate descent). Default "CD" nrep Number bootstrap repetitions. Default 5000 random_start Number random starting points optimization. Default 0 etamean Mean random variable re-randomization. Default 0.5 temp_dir Directory temporary files. Default automatically created system temp location verbose Whether print detailed progress messages. Default TRUE plink_path Path plink executable. NULL, use configured plink path config Use configuration configure_mrcare()? Default TRUE

title: CARE Mendelian Randomization Analysis — mr_care
text: list containing CARE results various bias correction methods model selection approaches

title: CARE Mendelian Randomization Analysis — mr_care
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Using file paths with configured environment care_results <- mr_care(   exposure_data = "path/to/exposure_gwas.txt",   outcome_data = "path/to/outcome_gwas.txt" )  # Using data frames with custom configuration care_results <- mr_care(   exposure_data = exposure_df,   outcome_data = outcome_df,   config = FALSE,   ref_panel = "/path/to/reference/panel",   plink_path = "/path/to/plink" ) } # }

title: Plot MR-CARE Results — plot_care
text: Creates forest plot MR-CARE causal estimates (BIC RIVW) confidence intervals

title: Plot MR-CARE Results — plot_care
code: plot_care(   care_results,   exponentiate = FALSE,   ci_level = 0.95,   xlab = "Causal effect",   title = "MRcare Results",   colors = NULL )

title: Plot MR-CARE Results — plot_care
text: care_results Results object mr_care function exponentiate Whether exponentiate estimates (e.g., odds ratios). Default FALSE ci_level Confidence level intervals. Default 0.95 xlab X-axis label. Default "Causal effect" title Plot title. Default "MRcare Results" colors Vector colors different methods. Default NULL (uses preset colors)

title: Plot MR-CARE Results — plot_care
text: ggplot2 object

title: Plot MR-CARE Results — plot_care
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ results <- mr_care(exposure_data, outcome_data) plot_care(results)  # Odds ratios plot_care(results, exponentiate = TRUE, xlab = "Odds ratio") } # }

what: Preprocess GWAS Summary Statistics for MRcare — preprocess_gwas_data
title: Preprocess GWAS Summary Statistics for MRcare — preprocess_gwas_data
text: function preprocesses GWAS summary statistics prepare use MRcare. standardizes column names, performs quality control, saves processed data file later use.

title: Preprocess GWAS Summary Statistics for MRcare — preprocess_gwas_data
code: preprocess_gwas_data(   gwas_data,   output_file,   data_type = c("exposure", "outcome"),   A1 = NULL,   A2 = NULL,   SNP = NULL,   CHR = NULL,   POS = NULL,   BETA = NULL,   SE = NULL,   Pval = NULL,   MAF = NULL,   N = NULL,   Zscore = NULL,   Ninput = NULL,   maf_filter = 0.01,   remove_ambiguous = TRUE,   verbose = TRUE )

title: Preprocess GWAS Summary Statistics for MRcare — preprocess_gwas_data
text: gwas_data Path GWAS summary statistics file data frame containing GWAS summary statistics output_file Path processed GWAS data saved data_type Either "exposure" "outcome" determine processing logic A1 Column name effect allele (default: NULL, try detect) A2 Column name allele (default: NULL, try detect) SNP Column name SNP ID (default: NULL, try detect) CHR Column name chromosome (default: NULL, try detect) POS Column name position (default: NULL, try detect) BETA Column name effect size (default: NULL, try detect) SE Column name standard error (default: NULL, try detect) Pval Column name p-value (default: NULL, try detect) MAF Column name minor allele frequency (default: NULL, try detect) N Column name sample size (default: NULL, try detect) Zscore Column name Z-score (default: NULL, try detect) Ninput Sample size available data (default: NULL) maf_filter Minimum MAF threshold include SNPs (default: 0.01) remove_ambiguous Whether remove strand-ambiguous SNPs (default: TRUE) verbose Whether print progress messages (default: TRUE)

title: Preprocess GWAS Summary Statistics for MRcare — preprocess_gwas_data
text: Path processed GWAS data file

title: Preprocess GWAS Summary Statistics for MRcare — preprocess_gwas_data
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Process exposure data exposure_processed <- preprocess_gwas_data(   gwas_data = "path/to/raw_exposure_gwas.txt",   output_file = "path/to/processed_exposure_gwas.rds",   data_type = "exposure",   Ninput = 10000 )  # Process outcome data outcome_processed <- preprocess_gwas_data(   gwas_data = "path/to/raw_outcome_gwas.txt",   output_file = "path/to/processed_outcome_gwas.rds",   data_type = "outcome",   Ninput = 15000 ) } # }
